title: Really Weird Crash
body:
Alright, so this is something that has only happened recently, but I'm not sure what to do.

First off, I tried logging in yesterday, and it worked. So I go to play a game, get to champ select, select my champ. We wait for 10 secs for game to start, and the window closes like normally. Except I don't see an LoL thing. So, I wait for a minute, and still nothing. I figured my game crashed. I re-log in, terminate my previous session, and come to the reconnect screen. I click "reconnect" and the same thing happens. I try this a few more times, unfruitfully. I then watch a show, hoping it may have just been a temporary thing. I try again, hoping to make a late entry rather than be absent totally. Same thing happens. I try a few more times until the game won't even boot up, having PvP.net Patcher Kernel thing appear. I try running as an administrator, as that usually bypasses the issue. Nope, same thing. So I gave up and prayed it would work today.

So here I am, trying to get in a game, same thing happens-it crashes right before champ loading screen. I then terminate, re-log and reconnect. I crash again. Anyone here know how to fix this? I would greatly appreciate the help.

replies.body:
It sounds like your client may be having a hard time establishing a solid connection to the gameserver. Most of the time this is caused by a local network setting that prevents the connection from being established, so I recommend working through our [connection troubleshooting guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if you continue to see this issue.
